abstract.p: Steven Erlanger of The New York Times wins award for European reporting from German Marshall Fund of the United States; Erlanger is one of few American journalists to have spent almost all of last year in war zones of Serbia and Kosovo (S)

block.p: One of the few American journalists to have spent almost all of last year in the war zones of Serbia and Kosovo, Steven Erlanger of The New York Times, has won an award for European reporting from the German Marshall Fund of the United States.

The Peter Weitz Prize, worth $10,000, rewards excellence and originality in reporting and analyzing European and transatlantic affairs. A runner-up prize went to a team from Business Week, which reported on Europe ten years after the Berlin Wall fell.

The Peter Weitz Prize, worth $10,000, rewards excellence and originality in reporting and analyzing European and transatlantic affairs. A runner-up prize went to a team from Business Week, which reported on Europe ten years after the Berlin Wall fell.
The German Marshall Fund was begun in 1972 with a gift from the German people, as a way to commemorate the postwar Marshall Plan.
